intro: Newcastelia interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted newcastelia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to harsh, dry environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and botanical gardens.
